intro: Helianthemum guttatum var. viscidum, commonly known as the sticky rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its small, fleshy leaves covered in a sticky, glandular coating. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a vibrant touch to rocky or coastal habitats. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in Mediterranean climates. Its unique texture and color make it a notable species in botanical gardens and natural landscapes.
